author: _shemnon
content:
However... EEST execute causes Nethermind to fork off.  Not sure why yet.
```
uv run execute remote \
  --fork=Osaka \
  --rpc-endpoint=http://<kurtosis-json-rpc>/ \
  --rpc-seed-key 04b9f63ecf84210c5366c66d68fa1f5da1fa4f634fad6dfc86178e4d79ff9e59 \
  --rpc-chain-id 3151908 \
    tests/osaka/eip7692_eof_v1/eip3540_eof_v1/test_execution_function.py
```

author: _shemnon
content: EEST tests are also not all execute friendly.  From not deploying test contracts to transaction gas limits, we will need to do some cleanup before we can turn it into a spammor.

author: _shemnon
content: (I cannot get blockscout to work in the MVK, so debugging it is a bit hard)

author: _shemnon
content: I just realized why EEST execute is having so many failures... all of the deploy contract wrappers are all in legacy mode.  So if a pre-positioned contract needs to be an EOF contract it's not getting deployed properly.
